streuMittelVergleich.title: De-icing Agent Comparison
streuMittelVergleich.subtitle: Comparison of de-icing agents for winter service: Pros and Cons
streuMittelVergleich.intro: In winter service, various de-icing agents are available to combat ice and snow on roads and sidewalks. Each agent has specific advantages and disadvantages that should be considered based on the area of application.

calciumchlorid.name: Calcium Chloride/Magnesium Chloride
vorteile: Very effective at extremely low temperatures

lavagranulat.name: Lava Granulate, Expanded Clay, Other Granulates

splitt.name: Grit
nachteile: Can scratch surfaces such as tiles and parquet

streuMittelVergleich.conclusion: The choice of the right de-icing agent depends on various factors such as ambient temperature, environmental impact, and cost. For extremely cold conditions, calcium or magnesium chloride is very effective, although more expensive and less eco-friendly. Natural de-icing agents like lava granulate or grit are more environmentally friendly but do not have melting properties and must be removed after winter.

steps.title: Tools
steps.intro: The right tools are crucial for effective winter service:

items.title: Shovel
items.description: A robust metal snow shovel. For nighttime use, a sturdy wooden shovel without a metal edge helps reduce noise.

items.title: Snow Pusher
items.description: Sturdy and efficient, especially for clearing large amounts of snow on sidewalks and driveways. Metal versions are ideal for harder snow.

items.title: Snow Scoop
items.description: A specially designed snow scoop for narrow sidewalks that quickly and precisely clears tight spaces.

items.title: Spreader
items.description: A spreader helps distribute salt and de-icing material evenly, which is particularly important on larger areas such as parking lots.

items.title: Snow Sweeper
items.description: Gas-powered models are ideal for long, hard-to-reach areas. They tend to be more durable than battery-operated machines, which can quickly lose power.

items.title: Broom
items.description: Perfect for sweeping up leftover grit after winter, leaving surfaces clean.

items.title: Vehicle for Winter Service
items.description: If you use a car for winter service, you can equip it with a snow plow at the front and a spreader at the back. Ensure the vehicle and attachments are safe and designed for winter operations.

steps.title: Selection of De-icing Materials
steps.intro: The choice of de-icing material depends on local conditions and weather:

items.title: Salt
items.description: Ideal for fast and effective ice removal. However, note that salt can damage plants and vehicles and also impacts the environment.

items.title: Sand and Grit
items.description: These materials are more environmentally friendly and provide good traction on icy surfaces. They are a great alternative if you wish to avoid salt or if you live in areas with strict environmental regulations.

items.title: Combinations
items.description: Often, combining different de-icing materials can yield the best results.

steps.title: Snow Clearing and Spreading
steps.intro: Effective snow clearing and spreading requires a systematic approach:

items.title: Pre-emptive Spreading
items.description: Monitor the weather closely and spread de-icing material just before snowfall begins. This allows the snow to melt immediately rather than settling. At 0°C or below, snow tends to stick, so early action is crucial.

items.title: Clearing Snow
items.description: Always start by removing the largest accumulations of snow. Push the snow aside, ensuring it doesn’t end up on roads or sidewalks.

items.title: Spreading
items.description: After clearing, spread the de-icing material evenly to prevent slip hazards. Use a spreader for large areas or a bucket and shovel for smaller spaces.

items.title: Monitoring
items.description: Regularly check the cleared and treated areas, especially during prolonged snowfall or heavy frost. Ensure there is enough de-icing material available and reapply if necessary.

steps.title: Post-Winter Service – Cleaning and Maintenance
steps.intro: Once the snow has been cleared and areas treated, you should clean and maintain the tools and materials:

items.title: Cleaning Tools
items.description: Remove any residual de-icing material from your tools to prevent rust. Shovels and clearing equipment should be stored clean and dry.

items.title: Removing De-icing Material
items.description: After winter, remove any excess de-icing material to protect the environment and prevent damage to plants and animals in spring.

conclusion.title: In Conclusion
conclusion.text: With proper planning and the right tools, you can efficiently and safely handle your winter service at home. If you need support or have any questions, TREU Service GmbH is always here to help.
conclusion.motto: Stay safe and enjoy the winter!
